intro: Gilia brevicula, commonly known as the shortleaf gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. This annual herb typically grows to a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters, featuring hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals and a distinctive yellow center. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
